author: Prakash Kamat
text:
The Goa Bird Conservation Network (GBCN) will conduct the second All Goa Waterbird Census (AGWC) across all major wetlands of Goa from January 17 to January 24.

The 2015 survey, which recorded nine threatened species, made Goa one of the few States to provide comprehensive information on the wetland bird population, Parag Rangnekar, president, GBCN told The Hindu on Friday.

“The collected data help in understanding the global distribution of birds, especially threatened species. It will indicate trends in decrease or increase in the number of birds in our wetlands which in turn point to the health of the habitats,” said Mr. Rangnekar.

The AGWC aims at documenting, collating data, undertake awareness programmes, and citizen science initiatives with respect to birds and their habitats.
title: Goa waterbird count to start from Sunday
